body.p: Elastin or Collagen? Choose which protein matches each description.
contributes to the ability of a blood vessel to return to its shape after it is compressed
consists of molecules that are disorganized, entangled and crosslinked
prevents rupture of the blood vessel

response.feedback: Correct. Elastin molecules are disorganized and cross-linked so that they can stretch out and return to their normal length when the force stretching them stops.
Incorrect. Collagen filaments are twisted protofilaments and have rope like qualities that provide stiffness.
Correct. Elastin molecules are disorganized and cross-linked so that they can stretch out and return to their normal length when the force stretching them stops.
Incorrect. Collagen filaments are twisted protofilaments and have rope like qualities that provide stiffness.

part.hint: This allows for tissues to return to their original shape after passive dilation (such as when a spike in blood pressure occurs).

response.feedback: Incorrect. Elastin molecules are disorganized and cross-linked so that they can stretch out and return to their normal length when the force stretching them stops.
Correct. Collagen filaments are twisted protofilaments and have rope like qualities that provide stiffness. This stiffness prevents rupturing.

part.hint: Arteries are under more pressure and will have a thicker layer of this protein.
